title: Environmental Entity Type Vocabulary
description: Domain-specific refinement of CEP entity types for environmental facilities, sites, permits, monitoring assets, and related entities.

terms.label: Environmental Site
terms.definition: A physical location of environmental relevance, such as a facility, monitoring station, remediation site, or natural area tracked in environmental data.

terms.label: Facility Operator
terms.definition: An organization responsible for operating an environmental site or facility subject to environmental regulation or monitoring.

terms.label: Environmental Permit
terms.definition: A permit, license, or authorization that governs environmental impacts, emissions, discharges, or land use at a site or facility.

terms.label: Monitoring Asset
terms.definition: An asset or instrument used to monitor environmental conditions, such as sensors, samplers, or other measurement devices tied to one or more sites or locations.

terms.label: Measurement Series
terms.definition: A time series or collection of environmental measurements produced by a monitoring activity or system, such as pollutant concentrations over time at a site.

terms.label: Regulatory Authority
terms.definition: A governmental or delegated body responsible for issuing permits, enforcing regulations, and overseeing environmental compliance for sites and facilities.

terms.label: Enforcement Action
terms.definition: An action taken by a regulatory authority in response to environmental non-compliance, such as a notice of violation, order, or penalty decision.

terms.label: Other Environmental Entity
terms.definition: An environmental entity that does not fit another, more specific category in this vocabulary but participates in CEP environmental graphs.
